text: Henry Michael Tingelhoff (May 22, 1940September 11, 2021) was an American football center. He played for the Minnesota Vikings of the National Football League (NFL) from 1962 to 1978. He was elected to the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 2015. He was born in Lexington, Nebraska. Tingelhoff died on September 11, 2021 from cancer at the age of 81.Vikings Mourn Passing of Mick Tingelhoff ==References== Category:1940 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in the United States Category:American football centers Category:Minnesota Vikings players Category:Sportspeople from Nebraska
title: Mick Tingelhoff
